title: Patcher not working (RADS ERROR: cannot connect to HTTP server)
body:
And after an hour of troubleshooting:

1) Switched to shitty WiFi I never use -> was able to patch and login.
2) Switch back to main internet -> was able to login.
3) Attempt to patch a backup (not updated) League folder with main internet -> was able to patch.

Okay that makes no sense. Wtf Riot?

replies.body:
These type of errors are commonly seen when there's an issue with your connection fully reaching our servers. In this instance, it looks like it was only a temporary drop, as it was resolved after the steps you listed above. I've seen you on the boards quite a bit, so I'm sure you've seen the context and suggestions I frequently provide in situations like this (troubleshooting from the local network to the ISP's network routing). 

If you encounter any further issues with this, I definitely recommend ensuring your network settings are aligned with that [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) I commonly provide. If you have any further questions about this, feel free to let me know.

Hi I'm bumping this. TheCurator has informed me that I'm not allowed to post things like this on General Discussion, because Riot answers these requests here.

Since I'm not allowed to ask a highly populated general board filled with players who might be able to help me understand why this happened, I expect a red response.
